newsitem.title: USA: Continental pilots' union sees long talks.
newsitem.headline: Continental pilots' union sees long talks.

text.p: The union representing pilots at Continental Airlines Inc said Thursday that its members were preparing for "protracted" negotiations with the company on a new contract.
The Independent Association of Continental Pilots said in a statement that the pilots were angered by the company's low offers.

"We would have to wait until the year 2002 before reaching levels of pay that will still fall short of today's industry standard levels," said Jim Brucia, a member of the pilot's negotiating team said.
A previous July 1 target date for reaching agreement was said to be unrealistic and the pilots were setting a new date of October 1 for reaching a contract agreement.
The union said it represents 4,000 pilots flying for Continental and some 1,000 flying for Continental Express.
